newsitem.title: FINLAND: Merger rumours boost Merita stock.
newsitem.headline: Merger rumours boost Merita stock.

text.p: Finnish banking group Merita Oy gained in active trade on Friday on hopes that the bank would find a merger partner among the Nordic insurers, brokers said.
At 1315/1115 GMT, Merita traded at 17.30 markka, up 0.50 or nearly three percent, and Merita A was the most actively traded stock in Helsinki at 12 million shares traded.
Brokers saw room for further gains, saying Merita had broken technical resistance at 17.00 markka. The next resistance was seen around 20.00 markka.
"The rumours are going on so strong that Merita will be testing 20.00 markka soon," one broker said.
Merita said on Thursday it had been in talks about cooperation with insurers Sampo and Pohjola, but the talks had ended without results.
Brokers said that announcement only fuelled expectations that Merita will be actively seeking a merger partner from among the Nordic insurers.
Merita was also boosted ahead of its 1996 earnings report due next Wednesday, February 12, brokers said.
